Saliency computations¶

Apr 22, 2019

Implementation of multiple kinds of saliencies a given image:

Distance based

  1. [AHES09]

  2. [AEWSusstrunk08]

  3. [GZMT12]

  4. [GWX18]

Bayesian saliency

  1. [XLY13]

PointCloud

  1. [GWX18]

Saliency.bayesian(image, **kwargs)[source]¶

Saliency computed according to [XLY13]

Parameters

  • image –

  • numSegments – number of segments in the superpixel segmentation. defualt: 200

  • sigma – sigma for the segmentation (???). default: 5

  • beta – position weight within the feature vector. default: 0.5

  • sigma_dev – sigma for image derivatives. default: 2.5

  • rho – small constant. default: 0.5

  • verbose – print or show inter-running debug results

Returns

Saliency.distance_based(image, **kwargs)[source]¶

Computes saliency map according to distance methods

Parameters

  • image – the image to which the saliency map is computed

  • feature –

    according to which feature vector the saliency is computed:

    • ’pixel_val’ - the value of the pixel itself

    • ’LAB’ - a feature vector using CIElab color space

    • ’normals’ - a feature vector using point’s normals

  • method –

    The method according to which the distance is computed:

    • ’frequency’ - the distance between blurred and unblurred image [AHES09]

    s1 = distance_based(img, filter_sigma = [sigma, 1.6 * sigma, 1.6 * 2 * sigma, 1.6 * 3 * sigma],
 feature = 'normals')

    • ’local’ - the distance between regions [AEWSusstrunk08] 

    s2 = distance_based(img, filter_size = 5, method = 'local', feature = 'normals')

    • ’context’ - distance between regions and position [GZMT12]

      param scales_number

      the number of scales that should be computed. default 3.

      param kpatches

      the number of minimum distance patches, dtype = int. default: 64

      param c

      a constant; default: 3 (paper implementation)

    s3 = distance_based(img, filter_size = 150, method = 'context', feature = 'pixel_val', verbose = False,
 scales_number = 4)
s3[s3 < 1.e-5] = 0

  • verbose – Print debugging prints. boolean. Default True

  • dist_type –

    the distance measure:

    • ’L1’ ** SHOULD BE ADDED **

    • ’Euclidean’

    • ’Mahalonobis’ - ** SHOULD BE ADDED **

  • filter_sigma – (for global method) size of the filter(s)

  • region_size – (for local and context aware methods) size of the region(s)/patch(es)

  • normals – given normals computation for saliency based on normals image feature

Returns

saliency map

Warning

Context aware is incorrect.

Saliency.range_saliency(image, salient_range)[source]¶

Mark closer ranges as salient

Parameters

  • image (np.array) – a range image for saliency

  • salient_range (float) – the range threshold for saliency

Returns

saliency image according to the salient range

Return type

np.array
